death.attack.oral_bleeding: %1$s punctured the oral artery while eating.
advancements.dental_handbook.root.desc: Oh, it's cavities! It's time to love your mouth!
advancements.dental_handbook.massive_ble: Eating with at least 3 level of oral injury. It really hurts!
advancements.dental_handbook.do_not_open: Obtain at least level 4 tooth decay
handbook.dental_handbook.landing_text: Is your tooth starting to ache? $(p)Don't worry, the $(item)Dental Handbook$() will teach you how to deal with cavities and reclaim pain-free feasting!
handbook.dental_handbook.category.basics: This contains the basic mechanics of the Dental Handbook mod. You can't play without reading this~
The $(item)Dental Handbook$() contains all knowledge about your teeth. $(p)As you might expect, all information is recorded here. You might not need this book, but someone will, right? (●´ω｀●)ゞ $(p)If you ever feel confused about what's happening in your mouth, come flip through this book!
Crafting the $(item)Dental Handbook$() is so easy!

Any entries written in $(o)italics$() are $(thing)basic$() entries - fundamental knowledge about your oral health. Recommended to read first. Most chapters contain one or more of these, so better look carefully. $(p)P.S. This sentence was basically copied from Botania.
handbook.dental_handbook.entry.tooth_dec: Sometimes after eating something, you might notice you've got $(item)Tooth Decay$(). $(p)Seriously, this doesn't look like a friendly buff. Drinking milk definitely won't remove it, as it's not a poison. $(p)If you're unlucky enough to get it, first: $(item)Tooth Decay$() won't disappear naturally. Without intervention, it'll stay with you forever.

Second, you'll notice your $(thing)eating speed$() slows down, with the exact value depending on your $(item)Tooth Decay$() severity. $(p)Finally, if left untreated, worse things will happen. $(p)Your teeth respect death - if you don't have $(thing)keepInventory$() enabled, they'll disappear when you die. Vice versa.
handbook.dental_handbook.entry.injury_or: This is the consequence of long-term neglect of $(thing)tooth brushing$(). $(p)When your $(item)Tooth Decay$() reaches a certain severity, continued eating may cause $(item)Oral Injury$(). $(p)After eating, your mouth will protest in obvious ways, like heavy bleeding, turning meals into painful experiences. $(p)Really unpleasant.

The damage from $(thing)Oral Bleeding$() depends on severity. Armor is useless against $(thing)Oral Bleeding$(). $(p)$(strike)Though if you intentionally die this way, you'll get a very interesting death message.$()
handbook.dental_handbook.entry.clean_ora: This buff is key to maintaining health. $(p)After complete $(thing)tooth brushing$() with certain toothpaste, you'll gain $(item)Clean Oral$() effect. During this duration, eating won't cause $(item)Tooth Decay$().
handbook.dental_handbook.entry.brush_tee: The most economical and effective way to combat $(item)Tooth Decay$(). Just a few seconds for long-lasting protection. $(p)To $(thing)brush teeth$(), hold toothpaste and toothbrush in different hands, then right-click and hold to apply toothpaste. $(p)Finally, right-click and hold the toothpaste-coated toothbrush to start $(thing)brushing$().
Naturally, $(thing)brushing$() takes some time. After completion, you'll get a clean mouth. $(p)After full brushing, depending on toothpaste used, it can reduce $(item)Tooth Decay$() levels.
handbook.dental_handbook.category.toothb: Knowledge about toothbrushes, but not limited to them?
handbook.dental_handbook.entry.toothbrus: One of the mod's core items, providing strong cavity-fighting power. $(p)To craft a toothbrush, first obtain $(item)Pig Bristles$() - the base material for all toothbrushes. $(p)With these, you can first craft a basic toothbrush to protect your eating immediately.
Early game, the $(item)Wooden Toothbrush$() is your best choice. Cheap but provides core functionality - it can be used for $(thing)brushing$(). $(p)Oh god, what an obvious statement.
handbook.dental_handbook.entry.redstone_: Compared to $(item)Wooden Toothbrush$(), has higher durability and faster $(thing)brushing$() speed. $(p)Not sure how the vibration works, but it's essentially a toothbrush - no other uses.
handbook.dental_handbook.entry.toothpast: Another core item of the mod, providing meticulous care. $(p)All toothpaste requires $(item)Toothpaste Tube$(). Without it, it's like the West without Jerusalem.

$(item)Charcoal Toothpaste$() is your best early-game ally. Simple materials, great mouthfeel - just looks ugly. $(p)When used for $(thing)brushing$(), provides $(item)Clean Oral$() effect and removes up to level 4 $(item)Tooth Decay$(). $(p)Actually should rinse after use, or mouth turns black.
Craft Charcoal Toothpaste - 1 attack 1 defense, simplest toothpaste

If your $(item)Tooth Decay$() level is too high? Charcoal becomes useless. If other materials are hard to get, try $(item)Flint Toothpaste$(). $(p)When used for $(thing)brushing$(), removes 1 layer of $(item)Tooth Decay$(), up to level 4. $(p)Its rough particles may wear your mouth, but very professional at decay removal.
handbook.dental_handbook.entry.golden_ap: Made from golden apples - expensive but tasty. $(p)When used for $(thing)brushing$(), provides $(item)Clean Oral$() effect (up to level 4 $(item)Tooth Decay$()) and extra $(item)Regeneration$().
Craft Golden Apple Toothpaste - sweet flavor~
handbook.dental_handbook.entry.lapis_laz: When used for $(thing)brushing$(), provides $(item)Clean Oral$() effect (up to level 3 $(item)Tooth Decay$()) and $(item)Luck$(). But can't enchant your mouth.
handbook.dental_handbook.entry.quartz_to: When used for $(thing)brushing$(), provides $(item)Clean Oral$() effect (up to level 4 $(item)Tooth Decay$()). $(p)Powerful decay removal, mouth-friendly.
handbook.dental_handbook.entry.redstone_: When used for $(thing)brushing$(), provides $(item)Clean Oral$() effect (up to level 3 $(item)Tooth Decay$()). $(p)No combo moves with Redstone-powered Toothbrush.
handbook.dental_handbook.entry.dental_fo: The ultimate solution for toothache. As long as you have teeth, $(item)Dental Forceps$() can extract one while removing all $(item)Tooth Decay$(). $(p)Due to limited medical technology, this causes some damage and adds $(item)Oral Injury$(). $(p)Note: Fewer teeth mean slower eating until you can't eat at all.
Bonus: Can be used to attack mobs - might knock out a tooth. Physics, amazing right?
